channel.title: Server help
channel.description: In my quest tab there is like points, pk points,dung points, forums who the owner is and etc... What file do you go into to change that? This is 317

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @zackary zackary
item.description:
@zackary wrote:

You will need to right click on the backround image, and click edit. Then open it up in paint. then paste over the image you want as the backround. make sure you make the image the same exact size. when done, just save it and open your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:11, topic:524859”][quote author=Driman Rune link=topic=643553.msg4331816#msg4331816 date=1373751628]
public final class Sprite extends DrawingArea {

public Sprite(int i, int j)
{
	myPixels = new int[i * j];
	myWidth = anInt1444 = i;
	myHeight = anInt1445 = j;
	anInt1442 = anInt1443 = 0;
}

public String location = signlink.findcachedir() + "/Sprites/";

public Sprite(byte abyte0[], Component component)
{
	try
	{
		[b]//Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(location+"mopar.jpg");
		Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);[/b]

Facepalm Null.
[/quote]
I assumed you meant the actual image was a Java file, not the file that handled the background.[/quote]
I have the cache, once i change it do I just put it in my c drive and it will update it auto?

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:8, topic:524859”]to change the background, search in client files,

I assume a file background.java not sure,

OR

if your client already has a custom background then search in your cache/sprites folder and check every files on their.[/quote]
Why would the background image be a Java file?

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

to change the background, search in client files,

I assume a file background.java not sure,

OR

if your client already has a custom background then search in your cache/sprites folder and check every files on their.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

Null Amount:

I’ll assume the background image is simply named “background.fileextension” so just search through your client files for a file named “background” and replace it with the image you want as a background image.

Theres no such thing in my client…

Read full topic

item.title: Server help
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

I’ll assume the background image is simply named “background.fileextension” so just search through your client files for a file named “background” and replace it with the image you want as a background image.
